synopsis: A vote to pass a bill that prohibits suction dredge mining on rivers and streams with essential salmonid species.
name: SB 3 - Establishes Restrictions on Suction Mining - Oregon Key Vote
pg: Highlights: Prohibits suction dredge mining operations in areas with essential salmonid populations up to the ordinary line of high water for rivers and streams with high salmonid populations (Sec. 4). Prohibits motorized in-stream placer mining from involving (Sec. 5): The operation of motorized equipment within 1,000 feet of a residence or campground between the hours of either 8 p.m. or sunset, whichever is earlier, and 8 a.m.; The operation of a motorized suction dredge which has a suction hose with an inside diameter exceeding 4 inches; and Involving the operation of motorized equipment in a manner harmful to freshwater mollusks, essential indigenous salmonid habitat, or habitat essential to the recovery and conservation of Pacific lamprey.
